chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 5th Offense and Operating w/ PAC - 5th Offense. The defendant was found guilty of OWI 5th Offense and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC - 5th Offense was dismissed by the court.

  • Devon M. Thronson was found guilty of OWI 5th Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Devon M. Thronson was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To defendant with copy of court appointed attorney bill and balance due.
Added attorney fees in amount of $310.00 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.
Court Appointed Attorney fees in the amount of $310.00 for Attorney Field.
Sentencing Hearing, 05/24/2022
notice of right to seek postconviction relief
plea questionnaire/waiver of rights

4:00 PM cases 22CF249 and 22CT42 called. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon M. Thronson in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Devon M. Thronson. 
The State recites the joint agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Counts 1 and 2 of the Information and acknowledges prior convictions. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Court finds the refusal in 22TR1545 to be unreasonable. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
On Count 1: Court sentences defendant to 1 year and 6 months in prison and 3 years extended supervision. 
On Count 2: Court sentences defendant to 1 year and 6 months in prison and 2 years extended supervision. 
Prison sentences and extended supervision sentences on each count are to run concurrent to one another. 
Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP. Defendant has 10 days credit. 
Conditions of extended supervision include: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
On Count 2: Defendant is to pay Court costs including the DNA sample surcharge. 
On Count 1: Defendant to pay a $600 fine plus costs including the DNA surcharge and the Mayo Hospital blood draw fee. 
Defendant's driver's license is revoked for 36 months and must install an IID for 36 months after license is reinstated.
Plea hearing on May 24, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

2:30 PM case 22CF249 and 22CT42 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon M. Thronson in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Devon M. Thronson. 
In 22CF249: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 4:00 (in person).
Same as Complaint just adding Count 5: Operating w/ PAC - 5th Offense.
Same as Complaint.

(1:30 PM cases 22CT42, 22CF249 called.) Prosecuting Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Devon M. Thronson in court. Attorney David W. Field in court for Devon M. Thronson.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF249 and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Field is to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant, case 22CT42 to ride along.
Arraignment on May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney David Field - at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $75.00 beginning 4/08/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.

(Covers 22CF249 and 22CT42)

(Cases 22CT42, 22CF249 are called at 11:21 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Devon Thronson appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Kelly Ronquist appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaints. State requests $5,000 cash bond. Defense requests significantly lowers cash bond or signature bond. Court orders $5,000 cash bond to cover both cases with various conditions. 
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation. Defendant updates phone number.
